metadata.description: Name of the Logic App to be created.
Azure region in which the Logic App should be created.

Name of the existing Log Analytics workspace that the Logic App should connect to. Note that the Logic App connects to a single workspace, but can query data across multiple workspaces. Use the 'Workspaces To Query' parameter to specify the list of workspaces that the Logic App should query data from.
Subscription Id of the existing Log Analytics workspace that the Logic App should connect to.
Resource Group name of the existing Log Analytics workspace that the Logic App should connect to.

List of workspaces that the Logic App should query data from. Should be a comma-separated array of values of the format ['/subscriptions/{subscriptionId1}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName1}/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/{workspaceName1}','/subscriptions/{subscriptionId2}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName2}/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/{workspaceName2}']
Frequency at whch emails should be received by the recipient(s). Select 'Day' for sending emails once a day, 'Week' for sending emails once a week, or 'Month' for sending emails once a month.
Email id of the recipient(s). To specify multiple email ids, use a semicolon-separated list.
Start Date and Time (in UTC) of the data to be queried by the Logic App. Use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ format.
End Date and Time (in UTC) of the data to be queried by the Logic App. Use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ format.

Use to filter data queried by the Logic App to a limited set of subscriptions in which Recovery Services vaults exist. Should be of the format '{subscriptionId1},{subscriptionId2},..'. Default value is '*', which enables the Logic App to query data across all backup subscriptions that are sending data to the specified Log Analytics workspaces.

Use to filter data queried by the Logic App to a limited set of regions in which Recovery Services vaults exist. Should be of the format 'location1,location2,..' (eg. eastus,westus). Default value is '*', which enables the Logic App to query data for vaults across all Azure regions in the specified subscriptions.

Use to filter data queried by the Logic App to a limited set of Recovery Services vaults. Should be of the format 'vaultname1,vaultname2,..'. Default value is '*', which enables the Logic App to query data for all vaults in the specified subscriptions and locations.

Use to filter data queried by the Logic App to a limited set of Azure Backup solutions being used in your environment. Should be of the format 'solution1,solution2,..' (eg. Azure VM Backup,SQL in Azure VM Backup,DPM). Default value is '*', which enables the Logic App to query data across all Azure Backup solutions being used.

Selecting 'true' enables the Logic App to avoid querying data that is sent to the legacy Azure Diagnostics table in the Log Analytics workspace(s). Excluding the legacy table improves query performance time.
Use to specify the granularity at which data is sampled in the case of trend graphs.
Tags to be assigned to the Logic App and the API connection resources.
Subject of the email to be received by the recipient(s).

body.Body:
The Logic App Run did not execute to completion.

Status: @{result('Scope')[0]['status']}

Learn more about how to troubleshoot the error
body.Subject: [parameters('emailSubject')]

body.Body:
Policy Adherence Report

Email Contents

1. Inline
a. Policy Adherence by time period for items backed up daily
b. Policy adherence by time period for items backed up weekly

2. Attachments
a. Policy adherence by backup instance for items backed up daily
b. Policy adherence by backup instance for items backed up weekly

Learn more about Backup Reports

@{variables('visual')}
body.Subject: [parameters('emailSubject')]

BackupInstanceTrendFunction
JobFunction

ReportFilter_Trend
